author: Florine C
title: Lowest service level ever
text:
Choosing to stay at this hotel for my business trip was the biggest mistake ever. Except for the proximity to the bank's premises that I was to have meetings in, there is no other positive factor. Being a 4star hotel, I was greatly disappointed in the service rendered.
On check-in, the reception was cold - and I thought maybe it was the early hours of the Sunday morning since I arrived at 6.45 am having flown more than 14 hours from Singapore. I reminded the reception that my travel agent had put through a request for a late check out on my departure on Wed night with payment of a half day's charge. I was told that he will need to check with his manager and I was to check back with the reception again on Mon.
The worst happened today when I checked with the reception again on the late check-out. The manager to,d me that his assistant will assist me. Whilst he stood next to his assistant and communicated to her in French (knowing full well I spoke only English), his assistant told me that they are overbooked by 7 rooms and thus is not unable to extend my check out time. However, if I were to pay the full rack rate then they are able to extend the check out time as requested. Honestly, I think this is taking advantage of the situation here. Instead of arguing further with them, I told them to please do the extension of checkout time.
This is indeed a bad experience and I will surely advise other colleagues coming though Paris not to stay at this hotel. And to think that they get quite considerable business from my bank.
